bibl.title: Despatch from Charles H. J. Taylor to James D. Porter
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Chas. H. J. Taylor to Hon Jas D Porter
Reply to Consular Des. No (21) in ref. to Stephen Lynch.
Chas. H. J. Taylor to Hon Jas. D. Porter

In reply, to your No 21. of date, May 17th 1887, in reference to Stephen Lynch I have to inform you, that he is dead. He arrived here in December 1855 1865 from Lynchburg Va, from this town he went to Careysburg where he lived until his death on a farm, belonging to him. He died in 1883 during the rainy season, of consumption. He had three boys living one named William aged 16, one Calvin aged 10 and one Stephen aged 8 years. His wife Jane Lynch, who came out with him from Virginia, is living, and has married
again to one Nelson Momen, who also came out with the emigration in 1865, from Lynchburg. She married this man shortly after her first husbands, decease. My informant is Robert Knuckles, who is the son of Jane Lynch, born in V'a and five years of age at the time he came here with his mother and stepfather.

Trusting that this may prove sufficient evidence, and information on the within subject, I have the honor to be, sir,
Your obedient servant
Chas. H. J. Taylor.
